gwtupload.server
Class UploadAction

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          transbit.tbits.common.Uploader
              gwtupload.server.UploadServlet
                  gwtupload.server.UploadAction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
Direct Known Subclasses:
GWTUploadServlet, ReportFileUploadServlet
public abstract class UploadAction
extends UploadServlet

Abstract class used to manipulate the data received in the server side.

The user has to implement the method doAction which receives a list of the FileItems sent to the server. Each FileItem represents a file or a form field.

Note: After this method is called, the FileItem is deleted from the session.

Author:
Manolo Carrasco Mo√±ino
See Also:
Serialized Form

doAction

public java.lang.String doAction(java.util.Vector<org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem> sessionFiles)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.servlet.ServletException
Deprecated. use executeAction

This method is called when all data is received in the server. Temporary files are not deleted until the user calls removeSessionFiles(request)

Parameters:
sessionFiles -
Returns:
the error message return an error string in the case of errors or null in the case of success.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
javax.servlet.ServletException

executeAction

public java.lang.String executeAction(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                      java.util.List<org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem> sessionFiles)
                               throws UploadActionException
This method is called when all data is received in the server. Temporary files are not deleted until the user calls removeSessionFiles(request) Override this method to customize the behavior

Parameters:
request -
sessionFiles -
Returns:
the text/html message to be sent to the client. In the case of null the standard response configured for this action will be sent.
Throws:
UploadActionException - In the case of error

removeItem

public void removeItem(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem item)
                throws UploadActionException
This method is called when a received file is requested to be removed and is in the collection of items stored in session. If the item does't exist in session this method is not called After it, the item is removed from the session items collection. Override this method to customize the behavior

Parameters:
request -
item - The item in session
Throws:
UploadActionException - In the case of an error, the exception message is returned to the client and the item is not deleted from session

removeItem

public void removeItem(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       java.lang.String fieldName)
                throws UploadActionException
This method is called when a received file is requested to be removed. After it, the item is removed from the session items collection. Override this method to customize the behavior

Parameters:
request -
fieldName - The name of the filename input
Throws:
UploadActionException - In the case of an error, the exception message is returned to the client and the item is not deleted from session
